word:
Chapter Thirty-Three - The Call for a Balanced Work

     Maintain Proper Perspective.--As the work advances, dangers arise that need to be guarded against. As new enterprises are entered upon, there is a tendency to make some one line all absorbing; that which should have the first place becomes a secondary consideration. The church needs fresh power and vitality, but there is great danger of taking on new lines of work that will waste their energies instead of bringing life into the church.--The Daily Bulletin of the General Conference, March 2, 1899.
